Operation 'Convert' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_input_details. Original summary is overly long and lists all formats inline, making it harder for AI agents to parse. Description duplicates summary without explaining inputs (source format, target format, coordinate list) or outputs (converted coordinate list). Improved version clarifies the conversion operation, specifies that it handles format conversion, and explains the purpose for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_summary: Convert the list of geo coordinates to a standard format - (latlon | utm | mgrs | ecef | epsg3857 | georef | cartesian)
data.current_description: Convert the list of geo coordinates to a standard format - (latlon | utm | mgrs | ecef | epsg3857 | georef | cartesian)
data.summary_suggestion: Convert geo coordinates to specified format
data.description_suggestion: Converts a list of geographic coordinates from one format to another. Accepts coordinates in any supported format and returns them converted to the specified target format (latlon, utm, mgrs, ecef, epsg3857, georef, or cartesian). Useful for standardizing coordinate data across different geographic systems.
data.reasoning: Original summary is overly long and lists all formats inline, making it harder for AI agents to parse. Description duplicates summary without explaining inputs (source format, target format, coordinate list) or outputs (converted coordinate list). Improved version clarifies the conversion operation, specifies that it handles format conversion, and explains the purpose for AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'Distance' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary is clear and actionable. Description lacks details about what distance metric is used, what the return value contains (distance value, units), and the practical use cases. Enhanced description clarifies the calculation method and return format for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_summary: Calculate the distance between two geo coordinates.
data.current_description: Calculate the distance between two geo coordinates.
data.description_suggestion: Calculates the distance between two geographic coordinates. Accepts two coordinate pairs as input and returns the calculated distance. Supports multiple distance calculation methods (e.g., great-circle distance, geodetic distance). Useful for determining proximity, route planning, and geospatial analysis.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and actionable. Description lacks details about what distance metric is used, what the return value contains (distance value, units), and the practical use cases. Enhanced description clarifies the calculation method and return format for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'Fence' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original summary uses awkward phrasing ('inside of a fence of coordinates'). Description lacks clarity about fence definition (polygon vertices), return format (boolean array or object), and practical applications. Improved version uses clearer geofence terminology, specifies input structure (test coordinates + fence polygon), output format (containment status), and use cases for AI agent context.

data.current_summary: Check if a list of coordinates are inside of a fence of coordinates.
data.current_description: Check if a list of coordinates are inside of a fence of coordinates.
data.summary_suggestion: Determine if coordinates are within geofence boundary
data.description_suggestion: Performs geofence containment checks on a list of coordinates against a defined fence boundary. Accepts a list of test coordinates and a fence polygon defined by coordinate vertices, then returns containment status for each coordinate (inside/outside). Useful for location-based access control, zone monitoring, and boundary validation.
data.reasoning: Original summary uses awkward phrasing ('inside of a fence of coordinates'). Description lacks clarity about fence definition (polygon vertices), return format (boolean array or object), and practical applications. Improved version uses clearer geofence terminology, specifies input structure (test coordinates + fence polygon), output format (containment status), and use cases for AI agent context.

message: Operation 'Sky' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original summary is generic and doesn't clarify what 'sky information' means. Description lacks input parameters (location, date/time format), output structure (what specific solar/lunar/eclipse data is returned), and use cases. Enhanced version specifies inputs (coordinates, datetime), outputs (sunrise/sunset, lunar phase, eclipse data), and practical applications for AI agents to determine relevance.

data.current_summary: Calculate sun, moon, eclipse and sky information for the date and location.
data.current_description: Calculate sun, moon, eclipse and sky information for the date and location.
data.summary_suggestion: Calculate celestial and sky data for location and date
data.description_suggestion: Calculates comprehensive celestial and atmospheric information for a specified geographic location and date/time. Accepts location coordinates and datetime parameters, returning solar data (sunrise, sunset, azimuth, elevation), lunar data (phase, illumination, position), eclipse information (if applicable), and sky conditions. Useful for astronomy, weather prediction, and time-based location services.
data.reasoning: Original summary is generic and doesn't clarify what 'sky information' means. Description lacks input parameters (location, date/time format), output structure (what specific solar/lunar/eclipse data is returned), and use cases. Enhanced version specifies inputs (coordinates, datetime), outputs (sunrise/sunset, lunar phase, eclipse data), and practical applications for AI agents to determine relevance.
